@kroscoo I agree that you want similar behavior at the last layer where that's sensible.  For multi-domain, similar output behavior.
E.g., regularize toward word embeddings θ that were pretrained on big data for some other objective. Coeff controls bias/variance tradeoff.
A regularization term will correctly influence optimizer to stay near θ at every step. And you can tune its strength by cross-validation.
Why count on your optimizer to fail and be influenced "just enough" by the initalizer? It was supposed to find the global argmin regardless!
If you suspect θ is a pretty good parameter value (e.g., pretraining), please regularize toward θ instead of just initializing at θ.  #ML
